comments.body:
Since the flatten parameters are compressed as one item in a list, and I need to compare the no-order list when updating.

The previous behavior will create the default name for the `public_ip_address_name` for the public ip if `public_ip` flag is set to true. And set the only one as `primary` one.
 
But going to list, it should specify a `primary` one among the list. Also I cannot set the default name for public ip, since it is difficult to know the updating. So I make the `primary` and `public_ip_address_name` required. As the `public_ip_address_name` is required if it needs public ip, the flag `public_ip` is no need here to identify whether it is public.
@jborean93 I answer the tree question in the single one. ðŸ˜…

comments.body: just curious, isn't this a config in load balancer, why add in azure_network_interface module?
in `loadbalancer` SDK, it simply ignore this param. And this API is exposed in NIC.
I suppose that before the receiving NIC has been created it doesn't make sense to add it to a load balancer. Reduces risk of faulty config atleast.
